channel.title: Little help with landscape editing
channel.description: ok first im using RSC community landscape editor that xEnt had released...what im trying to do is delete one little block so that i can add a ladder that goes downstairs (id 6) and have ppl actually see the ladder ive tried using the delete tile brush but all that does is turn it gray. i tried delete overlay which also didnt work...i tried putting black floor its literally what it says lol so was no help...anyways i was wondering if anyone knew how to delete one little block of area altogether?

item.title: Little help with landscape editing
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“Jonesy1128, post:18, topic:272318”][quote author=yong min link=topic=359290.msg2744916#msg2744916 date=1239568766]
Have you tried going to the Edgeville dungeon one on the editor and copy and paste that tile to the location you want it? -_-;
[/quote]

You could try using T X’s editor, as clicking a tile while show all it’s properties, then just mimic that where you want.

Be very wary using anything T X has touched ;)[/quote]

Yeah, i’ve seen T Xs editor

Thanks, Jonesy.

Read full topic

item.title: Little help with landscape editing
item.dc:creator: @Jonesy1128 Jonesy1128
item.description:
@Jonesy1128 wrote:

You could try using T X’s editor, as clicking a tile while show all it’s properties, then just mimic that where you want.

Be very wary using anything T X has touched

item.title: Little help with landscape editing
item.dc:creator: @Deathman17 Deathman17
item.description:
@Deathman17 wrote:

the problem is actually deleting the title…i was the transparent black tile like u see for ladders…like the one going to edgeville dungeon…problem is that i cant delete the tile completely…when i use remove tile brush it just turns the tile grey…when i use remove overlay it just does the same thing…i know how to set up ladders and stuff like that

Read full topic

You will need to delete it, then you will need to pleace an object the (ladder) then you will have to make the ladder work from xml edit (ObjectTelePoints.xml.gz) i think

item.title: Little help with landscape editing

item.description:
@Jonesy1128 wrote:

Open up the Edgeville segment. and check out the tile properties.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Should be h0x52y46

item.title: Little help with landscape editing
item.dc:creator: @Deathman17 Deathman17
item.description:
@Deathman17 wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:9, topic:272318”][quote author=Jonesy1128 link=topic=359290.msg2742307#msg2742307 date=1239431499]
I have no idea what you want.

Rewrite it more clearly and people will be able to help you.
[/quote]

I was also unable to fully understand the nature of his sentences. But re-reading it several times, I believe he is looking to totally remove a tile (so there’s no floor, tile there) so that the ladder will appear better to the users. (Take a look at the ladder leading down into Edgeville dungeon).[/quote]

that is correct…im trying to totally remove the tile but everything i try will not remove the tile i know what im trying to do but i cant find a way to do that

Read full topic

item.title: Little help with landscape editing
item.dc:creator: @Deathman17 Deathman17
item.description:
@Deathman17 wrote:

yeah i tried all of that…what im trying to get is a black space like say you teleport to 56 2946 its all black…if you use a command to add a ladder you can see the whole thing…because theres nothing around it…what im trying to do is do that to an area on the map that already has landscape on it…i just want to totally delete the tile so its kinda see threw so ppl can see the ladder better then just adding it there

Read full topic

theres no delete brush…theres remove tile, remove northwall, remove eastwall, remove overlay, remove diagonal, remove roof…no other delete tools

use the delete tile brush like you have, and then place a ladder there, 0,o? (you’d have to place the ladder through the server, I dont think the landscape editor has that)
